question: A closed water tank has cross-sectional area A. It has a small hole at a depth of h from the free surface of water. The radius of the hole is r so that <katex>$r\ll\sqrt{\frac{A}{\pi}}$</katex>. If <katex>$P_{o}$</katex> is the pressure inside the tank above water level, and <katex>$P_{a}$</katex> is the atmospheric pressure, the rate of flow of the water coming out of the hole is [p is the density of water]
images/2023-phy-42-1.png
explanation: Applying Bernoulli's equation: <katex>$P_o + \rho g h = P_a + \frac{1}{2} \rho v^2$</katex>. <katex>$\frac{1}{2} \rho v^2 = \rho g h + (P_o - P_a)$</katex>. <katex>$v = \sqrt{2gh + \frac{2(P_o - P_a)}{\rho}}$</katex>. Rate of flow <katex>$Q = Area \times v = \pi r^2 v$</katex>.
